intro: Hieracium uechtritzianum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes, where it tolerates cold and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium uechtritzianum is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to survive in harsh, windy environments.
